title: Respect for Rice!
detail_text: <:th_ch0008/>Hmm.... This game is too hard....<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0104/>How unusual for you to be playing a game, Hanayo-san<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0008/>Ah, Dia-san. You see, Rina-chan told me about this rice cultivating game. Rice cultivation in the real world is really hard, but I thought if it’s in a game, then maybe.... But it’s still hard even in a game....<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0104/>Let me take a look at it. ....I see, it’s quite realistic<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0008/>Yeah. It seems like not only do you need to know how to cultivate rice, but you also need to know the history behind rice<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0104/>Then that would be my specialty. First, let’s go to the library and research the history of rice cultivation. Let’s also look up some rice farmer’s websites<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0008/>Eeeh!? Y-, you would go that far for a game....? N-, no, you’re right. It’s about my beloved rice. So I have to know, right....<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0104/>That’s right! I understand your love for rice, Hanayo-san. Even if it’s just a game, let’s strive to produce the best rice!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0008/>Dia-san....!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0104/>If it’s about books, then Hanamaru-san is the right person. Let’s try contacting her<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0000/>Translated by SIFAStheatre and Idol Story<:dt_line_end/>
